bug.author: yanniszark
bug.description:
Commit <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/commit/cee39dbcfec7303ac61d3fbb08031acdaec0886f>cee39db</denchmark-link> broke the function by adding the following line:
kubeflow/components/jupyter-web-app/kubeflow_jupyter/default/app.py
Line 39 in 5397cc8
namespace = body["ns"]
This line is unnecessary because is already available inside the function. Am I missing something <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zabbasi>@zabbasi</denchmark-link> ? However, ns should be a value in body. How come it's not? The reason is because the ns field in the form has the HTML attribute disabled: true. Because of this, serializeArray() doesn't include it.
kubeflow/components/jupyter-web-app/kubeflow_jupyter/default/static/js/add_notebook.js
Line 27 in 5397cc8
var body = $(this).serializeArray()
To fix, we should change the HTML attribute of ns from disabled to readonly. Using image tag f6aa1dc. /priority p1 /cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kimwnasptd>@kimwnasptd</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.94. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

/assign <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kimwnasptd>@kimwnasptd</denchmark-link>
Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kimwnasptd>@kimwnasptd</denchmark-link> Would you mind picking this up?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> yes, fixed it in the HTML/JS UI before moving to Angular. Also, the new UI doesn't have this issue so we can close this.
